ygData.subject: Re: Error measure in NEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Lars, I believe the error variable is just there for convenience. That is, I don t think NEAT actually uses that number to make any decisions.  The field can

Lars, I believe the error variable is just there for convenience.  
That is, I don't think NEAT actually uses that number to make any 
decisions.  The field can be left blank without any negative 
consequences.  (note I could be wrong since I didn't write JNEAT, but 
I know JNEAT is based off my own code)

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "lars_v_hansen" <lvh@d...> wrote:
> Hi everybody
> 
> 
> I am wondering what effect the error parameter for each individual
> has. I am currently working on heads-up poker players. Each player
is
> assigned an error which is the squared difference from the fittest
> individual.
> 
> I am using the jNEAT implementation.
> 
> 
> Any help appreciated. Thank you :)
> 
> 
> 
> Best regards
> 
> Lars
